title: India Dominates World Archery Youth Championships: Priyansh & Aditi Swami Secure Double Gold!
content:
India's archers continued their incredible run at the World Archery Youth Championships in Limerick, Ireland.  **Priyansh Swami** and **Aditi Gopichand Swami** both secured their second gold medals of the tournament, adding to India's already impressive medal haul.

Aditi, the rising star of Indian archery, beat Leann Drake of the United States in the compound under-18 women's individual final. This victory followed her earlier team gold win with Aishwarya Sharma and Ekta Rani. 

Priyansh, meanwhile, dominated the compound under-21 men's individual event. After winning his quarter and semi-final matches by a single point, he defeated Aljaz Maltija Brenk of Slovenia to claim the gold. 

India currently sits atop the medal table with a staggering five gold, one silver, and three bronze medals. The final day of the championships will see the recurve individual events, promising more exciting archery action from the Indian contingent.
author: Scroll Staff
